question:
You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Take care to ensure the generated code is executable for demonstration.

Please help me implement the following requirement using code. Create an SVG illustration of: a newly married couple in wedding attire with a heart symbol positioned above them.

checklist.title: Is the SVG illustration of the married couple properly structured?
checklist.description: Review whether the SVG code follows proper structure with appropriate viewBox, dimensions, and namespace. Check if the core elements (bride, groom, heart) are properly defined within the SVG. Score 0 if the SVG structure is missing or severely flawed, 5 if basic structure exists but with issues, and 10 if the structure is complete and standards-compliant.

checklist.title: Are the wedding attire details well illustrated?
checklist.description: Evaluate the level of detail in the wedding attire for both characters. The bride should have a recognizable wedding dress (with details like veil, train, or lace) and the groom should have formal attire (suit or tuxedo). Deduct 3 points if one character's attire lacks detail, 5 points if both are overly simplified, and 7 points if attire is generic without wedding-specific elements. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the heart symbol properly positioned and styled?
checklist.description: Check if the heart symbol is clearly visible above the couple (not overlapping with the characters) and has appropriate styling (color, size, possibly animation). Deduct 5 points if the heart's position doesn't clearly indicate it's above the couple, 3 points if the heart is poorly styled or too small to notice, and 2 points if the heart lacks thematic connection to the wedding concept (e.g., wrong color palette). The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the illustration use appropriate visual composition?
checklist.description: Assess whether the composition follows visual design principles with proper balance, proportion, and focal points. The couple should be centrally positioned with the heart forming a visual triangle. Deduct 5 points for unbalanced composition where elements appear randomly placed, 3 points if the scale between elements is jarring, and 2 points if visual hierarchy is unclear. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the SVG code is resilient across different browsers and viewing contexts. Check for proper fallbacks, appropriate use of groups (<g> elements), and clean path definitions. Code with strong robustness should handle scaling gracefully and avoid rendering artifacts. Give 10 points for highly robust implementation, 5 points for average implementation with minor issues, and 0 points if the SVG breaks easily under different conditions.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Subtle animations like a beating heart 2. Interactive elements that respond to mouse hover/click 3. Gradient effects or decorative elements like flowers/rings). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant path definitions or duplicate elements 2. Unnecessarily complex paths that could be simplified 3. Excessive details that impair performance without visual benefit. Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if core visual elements are obscured by redundant elements.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modularity of SVG components, appropriate use of reusable elements, and optimization techniques. Deduct 5 points if paths are unnecessarily complex or unoptimized; deduct 3 points if there's no logical grouping of related elements; deduct 2 points if IDs/classes aren't used where appropriate for potential styling/animation. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color palette appropriate for wedding theme 2) Clean silhouettes with proper figure-ground relationship 3) Thoughtful use of stroke weights and fill colors. Deduct 3 points for clashing colors, 5 points for poor visual clarity between elements, and 5 points for inconsistent styling across the illustration. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether any included animations or interactions enhance the visual story: 1) Smooth transitions if elements animate 2) Appropriate timing for any effects (not too fast/slow) 3) Purposeful interactions that add meaning. Deduct 5 points for jarring or distracting animations, 3 points for performance issues during animation, and 5 points if interactions break the visual cohesion. The full score is 10 points.
